alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 3:10AM EST until December 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Thursday to 7 AM EST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to 1.5 to 2.5 feet mean higher high water around the time of high tide. These water levels will result in minor flooding in Apalachicola near the boat ramp and also along Water Street. Minor overwash is possible at Alligator Point Road. Along St George Island, there is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla
